H0.text: who was the head of the spanish inquisition. Tomás de Torquemada

H1.text: who was the head of the spanish inquisition. Pope Sixtus IV

H2.text: who was the head of the spanish inquisition. King Ferdinand II of Aragon

H3.text: who was the head of the spanish inquisition. Grand Inquisitor

A4.text: Tomás de Torquemada  (14 October 1420 – 16 September 1498), anglicized as Thomas of Torquemada, was a Spanish Dominican friar and the first Grand Inquisitor of the Spanish Inquisition.

A5.text: Henry Charles Lea observed that the Spanish Inquisition in both Castile and Aragon remained firmly under Ferdinand's direction throughout the joint reign.
